skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.
A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Thesops died by specifically by a minotaur's hand, but his blind hatred extends to all Beastmen.

effects.description: Melee attack: +20 when fighting against Beastmen

skillTree.localised_description: Among the shifting dunes, dawn is heralded by the scrape of sand against the panoply of war, and the murmur of long-buried warriors.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nagash is darkness and unreasoning hatred given form, the father and creator of the foul art of necromancy and lord of all Vampires.
There is enough left of the hero's soul to occasionally cause outbursts of desperate pain and torment, unsettling enemies who witness them.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: In a cruel twist of  irony the reanimated corpses of the minotaurs slain by Thesops are now forming his most elite retinue.

effects.description:
Speed: +20% for Skeletal Minotaurs (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +20% for Skeletal Minotaurs (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +20% for Skeletal Minotaurs (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once long ago Thesops was famous for hunting and slaying monsters. Neither his legend nor his home town endured, but an echo of his old skills still lingers in his corpse.

The spirit binds the pitiful former hero to its undead form and will prevent him from falling apart until his corpse has been hacked to pieces. Not even that will grant the fallen peace though. Their tormentor will use their magic to reconstruct the skeleton, regardless of the damage it suffered and force it to march against the living once again.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: The possessed corpse is infused with foul magic by its master, driven far beyond its physical limitations. Such powerful magic damages the corpse, but the malicious apparition controlling it does not care.
Thesops was the famous spellblade of Athanas. His legend died with his city, but an echo of his skill still endures, now serving a much darker master.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, its not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster unleashes the beast within, using its fury to transform allies into bestial forms.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wyssan's Wildform"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wyssan's Wildform Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wyssan's Wildform Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Sounding a gnarled horn, the caster summons a glowing amber spear and hurls it at the foe with uncanny accuracy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.
With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities
Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flock of Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Calling upon the beast spirits of the wild, the caster sheathes vulnerable flesh in unyielding fur and hide.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing at them with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they appear.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Curse of Anraheir"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Kadon, a master of forms, was able to shift his shape into anything he chose. This mastery is used to summon a Manticore, as if Kadon himself fights for you.

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawned unit fights in this battle only

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "Transformation of Kadon"

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Javelinmen, Royal Peltasts, Bone Throwers and Screaming Skull Ballistas units

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: Such evil creatures are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Magic-user can reanimate fearsome beasts to do his bidding.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
The many ranks of archers and artillery batteries will darken the sky and reap many souls.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Javelinmen, Royal Peltasts, Bone Throwers and Screaming Skull Ballistas units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Mummies, Cairn Wraiths, Skeleton Hoplites, Skeleton Pikemen, Royal Guards, Crypt Ghouls, Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: The power of death cannot be denied.

Leadership: +5 for Skeletal Minotaurs, Skeletal Elephant, Mortis Engine, Bone Hydra and Bone Colossus units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: An ancient hero that couldn't prevail against a mighty Minotaur. Now he's possessed by a spiteful spirit.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +12% for Skeletal Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 for Skeletal Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +15% for Skeletal Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)
This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities
